name: Nevada Museum of Art
description: The Nevada Museum of Art is the only accredited art museum in the state of Nevada, housed in a striking building designed by architect Will Bruder. The museum's collection spans contemporary art, photography, and works exploring the relationship between art and the environment. Its rotating exhibitions bring world-class art to the region, while the permanent collection focuses on art of the Greater West.
shortDescription: Nevada's only accredited art museum with contemporary art in a striking architectural landmark.

faqs.question: What type of art does the museum feature?
faqs.answer: The museum focuses on contemporary art, photography, and works exploring art and environment, with rotating world-class exhibitions.

faqs.question: Is the building itself noteworthy?
faqs.answer: Yes, designed by renowned architect Will Bruder, the building is an architectural landmark inspired by the Black Rock Desert landscape.

faqs.question: Is there a restaurant?
faqs.answer: The museum features a rooftop Sky Room with stunning views of downtown Reno and the surrounding mountains.
